main event: A bright light was observed for about 10 minutes in Lexington, Kentucky on January 8, 1961.
interesting points: The light was described as a 'small bright light' that was watched until it faded out.
The observer concluded the sighting was probably a meteor or satellite, as the light did not get smaller like an airplane.
Several people in the area also observed the object, which had several small white flashing lights and did not behave like an airplane.
The object was observed for about 20 minutes and at one point turned perpendicular and went behind some trees, disappearing from view.
A rough drawing was provided of the observed object.
